intro: Elaeodendron meyerianum, commonly known as the Meyer's elaeodendron, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub with smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
